content: Comparative operators can be used on any primitive types (except boolean), but only the "equals" and "does not equal" operators work on objects.  This is because the less-than/greater-than operators cannot be applied to objects, but the equivalency operators can.
stemmed: compar oper use primit type ( except boolean ) , `` equal '' `` equal '' oper work object . thi less-than/greater-than oper appli object , equival oper .
